added_lines: from sqlalchemy import or_def check_for_pending_or_processing_ops(session, object_uuid, seqnum=None, operation=None): q = session.query(models.OVNJournal).filter( or_(models.OVNJournal.state == journal_const.PENDING, models.OVNJournal.state == journal_const.PROCESSING), models.OVNJournal.object_uuid == object_uuid) if seqnum is not None: q = q.filter(models.OVNJournal.seqnum < seqnum) if operation: if isinstance(operation, (list, tuple)): q = q.filter(models.OVNJournal.operation.in_(operation)) else: q = q.filter(models.OVNJournal.operation == operation) return session.query(q.exists()).scalar() def check_for_older_ops(session, row): q = session.query(models.OVNJournal).filter( or_(models.OVNJournal.state == journal_const.PENDING, models.OVNJournal.state == journal_const.PROCESSING), models.OVNJournal.operation == row.operation, models.OVNJournal.object_uuid == row.object_uuid, models.OVNJournal.seqnum < row.seqnum) return bool(q.first())

subject: Configure Keystone Fernet Keys rotations in a secure way
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-22 02:25:57.000000000', 'files': ['elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.pp', 'releasenotes/notes/fernet_rotate_crontab-1a33439a76843a81.yaml', 'elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.yaml.template'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/instack-undercloud/commit/102b3120b97edc567ac716da230ca6b26824c6d1', 'message': "Configure Keystone Fernet Keys rotations in a secure way

Before this patch, we don't have any Keystone Fernet keys rotations.
If any key used in the key repository is compromised, an attacker will
be able to build their own tokens. If they know the ID of an
administrator on a project, they could generate administrator tokens for
the project. They will be able to generate their own tokens until the
compromised key has been removed from from the repository.

To avoid this situation, we're now scheduleing Key rotations:

- Rotate keys every 3 hours
- Tokens remain valid during 12 hours
- 6 active keys will remain deployed

The details of why we picked these numbers are documented here:
https://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide/identity-fernet-token-faq.html

The example took 24 hours but to be more secure, let's take 12 hours and
increase rotations to every 3 hours.

Change-Id: I1413e1553eb384f47913895dc6d732bf0999660c
Implement: blueprint keystone-fernet-rotation
Depends-On: I125e81d8cd130fadb8271f1b7bcdcf9794c79f47
"}]
commit_message:
Configure Keystone Fernet Keys rotations in a secure way

Before this patch, we don't have any Keystone Fernet keys rotations.
If any key used in the key repository is compromised, an attacker will
be able to build their own tokens. If they know the ID of an
administrator on a project, they could generate administrator tokens for
the project. They will be able to generate their own tokens until the
compromised key has been removed from from the repository.

To avoid this situation, we're now scheduleing Key rotations:

- Rotate keys every 3 hours
- Tokens remain valid during 12 hours
- 6 active keys will remain deployed

The details of why we picked these numbers are documented here:
https://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide/identity-fernet-token-faq.html

The example took 24 hours but to be more secure, let's take 12 hours and
increase rotations to every 3 hours.

Change-Id: I1413e1553eb384f47913895dc6d732bf0999660c
Implement: blueprint keystone-fernet-rotation
Depends-On: I125e81d8cd130fadb8271f1b7bcdcf9794c79f47
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/instack-undercloud refs/changes/44/448344/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # fernet tokens are valid 12h, rotations happen every 3 hours # max_active_keys = (token_expiration / rotation_frequency) + 2 = 6 # https://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide/identity-fernet-token-faq.html keystone::cron::fernet_rotate::hour: '*/3' keystone::fernet_max_active_keys: 6 keystone::token_expiration: 43200

subject: Refactor: block-device filesystem creation, mount and fstab
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-11 13:47:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder/commit/4dd780f35d380f9d0197ebc9e1a64cc978f4f01b', 'message': 'Refactor: block-device filesystem creation, mount and fstab

This patch finalizes the block device refactoring.  It moves the three
remaining levels (filesystem creation, mount and fstab handling) into
the new python module.

Now it is possible to use any number of disk images, any number of
partitions and used them mounted to different directories.

Change-Id: I592c0b1329409307197460cfa8fd69798013f1f8
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <andreas@florath.net>
Closes-Bug: #1664924

   $TMP_MOUNT_PATH/mnt (see I85e01f3898d3c043071de5fad82307cb091a64a9)

commit_message:
Refactor: block-device filesystem creation, mount and fstab

This patch finalizes the block device refactoring.  It moves the three
remaining levels (filesystem creation, mount and fstab handling) into
the new python module.

Now it is possible to use any number of disk images, any number of
partitions and used them mounted to different directories.

Notes:

 * unmount_dir : modified to only unmount the subdirs mounted by
   mount_proc_sys_dev().  dib-block-device unmounts
   $TMP_MOUNT_PATH/mnt (see I85e01f3898d3c043071de5fad82307cb091a64a9)

Change-Id: I592c0b1329409307197460cfa8fd69798013f1f8
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <andreas@florath.net>
Closes-Bug: #1664924
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/86/444586/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add httpd packages to glance API image

These are needed for the TLS termination that will go in front of
glance-api in the TLS everywhere case. This termination, however, will
be spawned in a separate container.

bp tls-via-certmonger-containers

commit_message:
docker/internal TLS: spawn extra container for swift's TLS proxy

This spawns an extra container that runs httpd to run the TLS proxy that
will go in front of swift.

bp tls-via-certmonger-containers

Depends-On: Ib01137cd0d98e6f5a3e49579c080ab18d8905b0d
Change-Id: I9639af8b46b8e865cc1fa7249bf1d8b1b978adfe

commit_message:
Add httpd packages to swift proxy image

These are needed for the TLS termination that will go in front of
swift-proxy in the TLs everywhere case. This termination, however, will
be spawned in a separate container.

bp tls-via-certmonger-containers

Change-Id: Ib01137cd0d98e6f5a3e49579c080ab18d8905b0d

commit_message:
build-test-packages: skip some projects

Add projects to the skip list that cannot be built by DLRN but they
are occasionally in the changes list.

Co-Authored-By: Sagi Shnaidman <sshnaidm@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I741a860cdea5f36b0660b55c56364d3e92821b95

extend security_group and _rule with project id

This allows admins to manage security groups and rules across
projects.

Story: #4193

commit_message:
Fix NotImplementedError and use new way to define action_present/past

Before Ocata cycle, the way to define action messages in
horizon DeleteAction was changed for better translation support
(pluralization and better word order control).
The previous way with data_type_singular/plural is deprecated.
This commit cleans up the deprecated usage.

Change-Id: I490239f187376fece83e2c6f9cdc601669ef45c8
Closes-Bug: #1688461

commit_message:
Collect Bios, Memory and Processor Info from Dmidecode

Proposing a spec to add additional bios, memory, and cpu data fields
to node properties from the dmidecode output collected by a new
collector in Ironic Python Agent.

Change-Id: I7be236e3dc96fea5ad310395c21332a33d7f4bb8
Partial-Bug: #1635057
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-inspector-specs refs/changes/90/406790/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================================================== Reporting Processor, Memory, Bios Dmidecode Introspection Data ============================================================== https://bugs.launchpad.net/ironic-python-agent/+bug/1635057 As of today, node introspection data provides information related to cpu, memory and bios. However, a few more key data fields are important to help deployers select nodes matching specific criteria to facilitate smart scheduling. Currently, total and physical memory size are collected. However, more specific information about DIMMs would help deployers to schedule nodes for low latency workloads. Similarly, cpu data fields such as signature and socket designation would be useful for inventory management. This spec proposes a collector for Ironic Inspector to obtain a few more key details of cpu, memory and bios. Problem description =================== Configuring nodes for better performance is a priority from the operator’s point of view. The operator can specify node capabilities in a Nova flavor for a node to be selected for scheduling[1]. Collecting key cpu, memory and bios data fields will enable operator to create flavors based on discovered hardware features. Here is a list of the key data fields that will be of use for this purpose: Bios Version: To know which firmware version is running on the host, for maintenance reasons. Socket Designation: To know which cpu is seated in which socket, useful for inventory management. Signature: To know which CPU features are available. Max Speed: To know single thread performance. Core Count, Core Enabled, Thread Count: To know about hyperthreading, smart scheduling. Number Of Memory Devices: This is needed for low latency workloads, to ensure lowest possible latency environment for an application (for Nova scheduler to select a node matching specific criteria). Memory Device Size: Same as above. Memory Device Speed: Same as above. Proposed change =============== The proposed change is to implement a collector for listing the details of processor, memory and bios in Ironic Python Agent’s inspector module using dmidecode utility and then return the collected data to Ironic Inspector. The processing done on this data in Ironic Python Agent is limited, this is to allow for server side plugin to process as much or as little of the data as needed. Format of the data collected by the new collector in IPA looks like this:: "dmidecode": { "bios": [ { ... "Version": "SE5C610.86B.01.01.0016.033120161139", ... }, ], "processor": [ { ... "Socket Designation": "CPU1", "Core Count": "18", "Core Enabled": "18", "Signature": "Type 0, Family 6, Model 63, Stepping 2", "Thread Count": "36", "Max Speed": "4000 MHz", }, ... ], "memory": [ { ... "Number Of Devices": "6", }, { ... "Form Factor": "DIMM", "Speed": "2133 MHz", "Size": "16384 MB", }, ... ] }, Here is a sample inventory output: http://paste.openstack.org/show/3CdiTNiWGmHA4PHxR7sI/ The second part of the change is to write an Ironic Inspector plugin, which processes the dmidecode output in the inspection data and updates nodes with configured properties for use by Nova scheduler. The Ironic Inspector configuration includes a dmidecode group for bios, memory and processor properties and their corresponding values. Each defined property will behave similar to the current node properties such as cpu_arch and local_gb. The configuration options group looks like this: [dmidecode] bios_version= number_of_dimms= size_of_dimm= speed_of_dimm= cpu_signature= cpu_max_speed= core_count= cores_enabled= thread_count= Update node's properties based on the above optional config options, for example, number of DIMMs. The number of DIMMs in the inspection data collected from Ironic Python Agent is processed by the dmidecode plugin in Ironic Inspector and added to node's properties. This information can later be used in Nova flavors for node scheduling[2]. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None HTTP API impact --------------- None Client (CLI) impact ------------------- None Ironic python agent impact -------------------------- The change proposed above will be implemented in IPA. Performance and scalability impact ---------------------------------- None Security impact --------------- None Deployer impact --------------- The deployer will be able to get more data about the CPUs, DIMMs and Bios. This information would be useful in configuring the system for better performance. The deployer will provide the optional collector via ipa-inspection-collectors kernel argument. Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Ramamani Yeleswarapu <Rama_Y> Work Items ---------- * Implement the collection of processor, memory and bios fields mentioned above using dmidecode utility in a new collector in IPA. * Implement a plugin in Ironic Inspector to add specific data to node properties based on config options. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Unit test cases will be added. References ========== .. [1] http://docs.openstack.org/project-install-guide/baremetal/draft/configure-integration.html#configure-compute-flavors-for-use-with-the-bare-metal-service .. [2] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/tripleo-docs/advanced_deployment/profile_matching.html

commit_message:
use extra_dhcp_opt api-def from neutron-lib

neutron-lib 1.6.0 is out and among other things contains the rehomed
extra_dhcp_opt API definition. This patch switches usage of such
references from neutron to neutron-lib.

Change-Id: I8fa397c88f50d0f80937907f1280fa8ac4a628d2

commit_message:
DevStack plugin: fix for recent neutron and devstack changes

- Set variables so that configure_neutron_after_post_config does not set
  service_plugins.  (What changed here has that neutron-legacy's setting
  of service_plugins was deferred.  Previously neutron-legacy set some
  value, and then the networking-calico deleted that.  Now
  neutron-legacy sets its value after the last time that the
  networking-calico plugin code has run.)

- Don't use systemd, as our running of auto-bird-conf is not
  systemd-compatible yet.

- Remove 'coverage=eventlet' declaration from .coveragerc.

- Also disable q-metering, as we have no use for it.

Change-Id: If08b226ce53051e50030ee961a9b05a62d44b204
Closes-Bug: #1689483
Closes-Bug: #1690101
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-calico refs/changes/98/463498/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Tell configure_neutron_after_post_config not to set service_plugins. # The Calico plugin provides the 'router' extension itself and does # not want a service plugin to try to handle that extension also. Q_SERVICE_PLUGIN_CLASSES=

commit_message:
Remove usage of parameter enforce_type

Oslo.config deprecated parameter enforce_type and change its default
value to True in Ifa552de0a994e40388cbc9f7dbaa55700ca276b0. Remove
the usage of it to avoid DeprecationWarning: "Using the 'enforce_type'
argument is deprecated in version '4.0' and will be removed in version
'5.0': The argument enforce_type has changed its default value to True
and then will be removed completely."

Change-Id: I91b0f0a52b5ce8654702510eed76d5dea8cc8fe4
Related--Bug: #1517839

commit_message:
Include all tripleo-common* packages from current dlrn

openstack-tripleo-common now depends on
openstack-tripleo-common-containers. If this package is not explicitly
included in the packages from the 'current' repo, undercloud updates
fail with an error similar to:

Error: Package: openstack-tripleo-common-7.0.1-0.zzz.el7.centos.noarch (delorean-current)
           Requires: openstack-tripleo-common-containers = 7.0.1-0.zzz.el7.centos

Change-Id: I5c112dc7f5530e246ce66f7491c604930290ff2f

commit_message:
Fix Incorrect timezone in ubuntu horizon images

Ubuntu removed tzdata and locales from docker images by default,
this is causing horizon to not come up failing
setting timezone:
```ValueError: Incorrect timezone setting: UTC```

Change-Id: I5bbc4d949ed481d1f6629dbb2f5edad174a36e63
Closes-Bug: #1686830

commit_message:
Failure to launch dashboard with error about missing class methods

While attempting to launch the dashboard, failures are reported about
missing methods like:

2017-05-09 12:11:59.784107 NotImplementedError: The DeleteParameter
BatchAction class must have both action_past and action_present
methods.

I've added two two missing methods.

Change-Id: Ia841aedd62973d0bb52c1a6a82e1c9bd8dc9d47c

commit_message:
Add ability for ceph driver to report discard

Currently, ceph backend has supported discard.
RBD images are sparse, thus size after creation is equal to 0 MB.
The main issue with sparse images is that images grow to
eventually reach their entire size. The thing is Ceph doesn’t know
anything that this happening on top of that block especially
if you have a filesystem. You can easily write the entire filesystem
and then delete everything, Ceph will still believe that the block is
fully used and will keep that metric.
However thanks to the discard support on the block device,
the filesystem can send discard flush commands to the block.
In the end, the storage will free up blocks.
This feature was added into the Kernel 3.18.

So far the openstack enable discard support for virtual machine
ephemeral root disk.
a link to external (Ceph) docs:
http://docs.ceph.com/docs/master/rbd/rbd-openstack/

this bp enable discard support for the attached volume.

Thanks Danny Wilson's work, on this basis, I just add support for CEPH
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/cinder-backend-report-discard  #noqa

test:
[root@2C5_19_CG1 ~]# rados -p vms_20 ls|grep rbd_data.63bd1445fe6 |wc -l
478
after deleting files in the virtual machine
[root@2C5_19_CG1 ~]# rados -p vms_20 ls|grep rbd_data.63bd1445fe6 |wc -l
354
So, this patch adds ability for ceph driver to report discard

Change-Id: I094163b99d858384584966d65e9d8756c74a0c15
Implements: blueprint ceph-report-discard

commit_message:
Bulk up port context retrieval

With the switch to subquery relationships, individual get_port calls
can get expensive with large numbers of ports
(100ms per port in my dev environment). This patch bulks up the
retrieval of the port contexts so one set of queries covers all
of the devices in an RPC call.

Partial-Bug: #1665215
Change-Id: I63757e143b23c24c349be98dc5a09115b8709a25

added_lines: from sqlalchemy import or_ def partial_port_ids_to_full_ids(self, context, partial_ids): """Takes a list of the start of port IDs and returns full IDs. Returns dictionary of partial IDs to full IDs if a single match is found. """ result = {} to_full_query = (context.session.query(models_v2.Port.id). filter(or_(*[models_v2.Port.id.startswith(p) for p in partial_ids]))) candidates = [match[0] for match in to_full_query] for partial_id in partial_ids: matching = [c for c in candidates if c.startswith(partial_id)] if len(matching) == 1: result[partial_id] = matching[0] continue if len(matching) < 1: LOG.info(_LI("No ports have port_id starting with %s"), partial_id) elif len(matching) > 1: LOG.error(_LE("Multiple ports have port_id starting with %s"), partial_id) return result def get_port_db_objects(self, context, port_ids): """Takes a list of port_ids and returns matching port db objects. return format is a dictionary keyed by passed in IDs with db objects for values or None if the port was not present. """ port_qry = (context.session.query(models_v2.Port). filter(models_v2.Port.id.in_(port_ids))) result = {p: None for p in port_ids} for port in port_qry: result[port.id] = port return result # TODO(kevinbenton): here for backwards compat. remove after backport return self.get_bound_port_contexts( plugin_context, [port_id], host)[port_id] @utils.transaction_guard @db_api.retry_if_session_inactive(context_var_name='plugin_context') def get_bound_port_contexts(self, plugin_context, dev_ids, host=None): result = {} dev_to_full_pids = self.partial_port_ids_to_full_ids( plugin_context, dev_ids) # get all port objects for IDs port_dbs_by_id = self.get_port_db_objects( plugin_context, dev_to_full_pids.values()) # get all networks for PortContext construction net_filters = {'id': list({p.network_id for p in port_dbs_by_id.values()})} nets_by_netid = {n['id']: n for n in self.get_networks(plugin_context, filters=net_filters)} for dev_id in dev_ids: if dev_id not in dev_to_full_pids: result[dev_id] = None continue port_id = dev_to_full_pids[dev_id] if port_id not in port_dbs_by_id: result[dev_id] = None continue port_db = port_dbs_by_id[port_id] network = nets_by_netid.get(port_db.network_id) if not network: # net concurrently deleted result[dev_id] = None continue port = self._make_port_dict(port_db) if port['device_owner'] == const.DEVICE_OWNER_DVR_INTERFACE: binding = db.get_distributed_port_binding_by_host( plugin_context, port['id'], host) if not binding: LOG.error(_LE("Binding info for DVR port %s " "not found"), port_id) return None levels = db.get_binding_levels(plugin_context, port_db.id, host) port_context = driver_context.PortContext( self, plugin_context, port, network, binding, levels) else: # since eager loads are disabled in port_db query # related attribute port_binding could disappear in # concurrent port deletion. # It's not an error condition. binding = port_db.port_binding if not binding: LOG.info(_LI("Binding info for port %s was not found, " "it might have been deleted already."), port_id) return levels = db.get_binding_levels(plugin_context, port_db.id, port_db.port_binding.host) port_context = driver_context.PortContext( self, plugin_context, port, network, binding, levels) result[dev_id] = port_context return {d: self._bind_port_if_needed(pctx) if pctx else None for d, pctx in result.items()}

added_lines: # Keystone PasteDeploy configuration file. [filter:debug] use = egg:oslo.middleware#debug [filter:request_id] use = egg:oslo.middleware#request_id [filter:build_auth_context] use = egg:keystone#build_auth_context [filter:token_auth] use = egg:keystone#token_auth [filter:json_body] use = egg:keystone#json_body [filter:cors] use = egg:oslo.middleware#cors oslo_config_project = keystone [filter:http_proxy_to_wsgi] use = egg:oslo.middleware#http_proxy_to_wsgi [filter:healthcheck] use = egg:oslo.middleware#healthcheck [filter:ec2_extension] use = egg:keystone#ec2_extension [filter:ec2_extension_v3] use = egg:keystone#ec2_extension_v3 [filter:s3_extension] use = egg:keystone#s3_extension [filter:url_normalize] use = egg:keystone#url_normalize [filter:sizelimit] use = egg:oslo.middleware#sizelimit [filter:osprofiler] use = egg:osprofiler#osprofiler [app:public_service] use = egg:keystone#public_service [app:service_v3] use = egg:keystone#service_v3 [app:admin_service] use = egg:keystone#admin_service [pipeline:public_api] # The last item in this pipeline must be public_service or an equivalent # application. It cannot be a filter. pipeline = healthcheck cors sizelimit http_proxy_to_wsgi osprofiler url_normalize request_id build_auth_context token_auth json_body ec2_extension public_service [pipeline:admin_api] # The last item in this pipeline must be admin_service or an equivalent # application. It cannot be a filter. pipeline = healthcheck cors sizelimit http_proxy_to_wsgi osprofiler url_normalize request_id build_auth_context token_auth json_body ec2_extension s3_extension admin_service [pipeline:api_v3] # The last item in this pipeline must be service_v3 or an equivalent # application. It cannot be a filter. pipeline = healthcheck cors sizelimit http_proxy_to_wsgi osprofiler url_normalize request_id build_auth_context token_auth json_body ec2_extension_v3 s3_extension service_v3 [app:public_version_service] use = egg:keystone#public_version_service [app:admin_version_service] use = egg:keystone#admin_version_service [pipeline:public_version_api] pipeline = healthcheck cors sizelimit osprofiler url_normalize public_version_service [pipeline:admin_version_api] pipeline = healthcheck cors sizelimit osprofiler url_normalize admin_version_service [composite:main] use = egg:Paste#urlmap /v2.0 = public_api /v3 = api_v3 / = public_version_api [composite:admin] use = egg:Paste#urlmap /v2.0 = admin_api /v3 = api_v3 / = admin_version_api

commit_message:
Add Opendaylight ML2 configuration options

Two additional config options, port_binding_controller and
odl_hostconf_uri are added to Opendaylight ML2 config file.
Those settings are required for integrating VPP with Honeycomb
agent support.

Partial-Bug: 1675211

Change-Id: I5004fdeb238dea81bc4f7e9437843a8a080d5b46
Signed-off-by: Feng Pan <fpan@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 5adc803d228a24244e6751672cd41b30bdc8b295)
(cherry picked from commit c35df3a6c3d0c0e39347095313556f29636d6d27)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/91/463991/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*port_binding_controller*] # (optional) Name of the controller to be used for port binding. # Defaults to $::os_service_default # # [*odl_hostconf_uri*] # (optional) Path for ODL host configuration REST interface. # Defaults to $::os_service_default # $package_ensure = 'present', $odl_username = $::os_service_default, $odl_password = $::os_service_default, $odl_url = $::os_service_default, $ovsdb_connection = 'tcp:127.0.0.1:6639', $port_binding_controller = $::os_service_default, $odl_hostconf_uri = $::os_service_default, 'ml2_odl/username': value => $odl_username; 'ml2_odl/password': value => $odl_password; 'ml2_odl/url': value => $odl_url; 'ml2_odl/port_binding_controller': value => $port_binding_controller; 'ml2_odl/odl_hostconf_uri': value => $odl_hostconf_uri;

commit_message:
Add a bootstrap script to build deployment host.

Do following jobs:
* Run dist-upgrade automatically.
* Update and configure ntp in interactive mode.

Change-Id: I2c0673cf2c34cd06123adc3cdd7e74724727981c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/51/463451/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/usr/bin/env bash # Copyright 2017, Fiberhome, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. # # (c) 2017, Fergus Yu <mfyu@fiberhome.com> ## Shell Opts ---------------------------------------------------------------- set -e -u -x ## Vars ---------------------------------------------------------------------- export HTTP_PROXY=${HTTP_PROXY:-""} export HTTPS_PROXY=${HTTPS_PROXY:-""} export DEBIAN_FRONTEND=${DEBIAN_FRONTEND:-"noninteractive"} # This script should be executed from the root directory of the cloned repo cd "$(dirname "${0}")/.." ## Functions ----------------------------------------------------------------- info_block "Checking for required libraries." 2> /dev/null || source scripts/scripts-library.sh ## Main ---------------------------------------------------------------------- info_block "Bootstrapping Deployment Host" # Determine the distribution which the host is running on determine_distro # Upgrade system and install the base packages case ${DISTRO_ID} in centos|rhel) info_block "Do not support to bootstrap for centos&rhel currently." exit 88 #TODO: Support to bootstrap for centos&rhel ;; ubuntu) upgrade_ubuntu_system DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive apt-get -y install \ aptitude build-essential git ntp ntpdate \ openssh-server python-dev sudo ;; esac # Configure NTP to synchronize with a suitable time source if necessary # Scenario: Can not connect to internet loadvars NTP_SERVER "ntp.ubuntu.com" service ntp stop ntpdate $NTP_SERVER if [[ $NTP_SERVER != "ntp.ubuntu.com" ]]; then sed -i "/^pool.*iburst/d" /etc/ntp.conf sed -i "/pool ntp.ubuntu.com/i\pool ${NTP_SERVER} iburst" /etc/ntp.conf fi service ntp start echo "Deployment host is bootstrapped and ready for use."

commit_message:
Removed py27dj18 from tox

Removed py27dj18 from tox and used py27, py27 is being used in all
the freezer components
Replace py35 in testenv instead of py34dj18
py3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due to the change from
Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only py3.5 is available.

Change-Id: I5c2adb466c5c84043f1ffa769e77c2e1734e6f18

commit_message:
Add 'rm -f .testrepository/times.dbm' command in testenv

Running py2* post py3* tests results in error. Add
'rm -f .testrepository/times.dbm' command in testenv to
resolve this.

Change-Id: Ibeabf819616b639e5fd7b09a2592bb70fcefeadd

commit_message:
3PAR: Added Replication Feature In Retype Flow

Added ReplicateVolumeTask in retype flow, which will check and
apply/remove replication feature on volume based on new type.

Change-Id: Id53b9cbdc90fd18290747cd6ed5dd6f4673294dd
Closes-Bug: #1680313
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/62/454062/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: TuneVolumeTask(action), ReplicateVolumeTask(action)) def _do_volume_replication_setup(self, volume, retype=False, dist_type_id=None): if retype and dist_type_id is not None: dist_type = self._get_volume_type(dist_type_id) extra_specs = dist_type.get("extra_specs") else: extra_specs = volume_type.get("extra_specs") def _do_volume_replication_destroy(self, volume, rcg_name=None, retype=False): if not retype: self.client.deleteVolume(vol_name)class ReplicateVolumeTask(flow_utils.CinderTask): """Task to replicate a volume. This is a task for adding/removing the replication feature to volume. It is intended for use during retype(). This task has no revert. # TODO(sumit): revert back to original volume extra-spec """ def __init__(self, action, **kwargs): super(ReplicateVolumeTask, self).__init__(addons=[action]) def execute(self, common, volume, new_type_id): new_replicated_type = False if new_type_id: new_volume_type = common._get_volume_type(new_type_id) extra_specs = new_volume_type.get('extra_specs', None) if extra_specs and 'replication_enabled' in extra_specs: rep_val = extra_specs['replication_enabled'] new_replicated_type = (rep_val == "<is> True") if common._volume_of_replicated_type(volume) and new_replicated_type: # Retype from replication enabled to replication enable. common._do_volume_replication_destroy(volume, retype=True) common._do_volume_replication_setup( volume, retype=True, dist_type_id=new_type_id) elif (not common._volume_of_replicated_type(volume) and new_replicated_type): # Retype from replication disabled to replication enable. common._do_volume_replication_setup( volume, retype=True, dist_type_id=new_type_id) elif common._volume_of_replicated_type(volume): # Retype from replication enabled to replication disable. common._do_volume_replication_destroy(volume, retype=True)
deleted_lines: TuneVolumeTask(action)) def _do_volume_replication_setup(self, volume): extra_specs = volume_type.get("extra_specs") def _do_volume_replication_destroy(self, volume, rcg_name=None): self.client.deleteVolume(vol_name)

commit_message:
Add missing testcases for migration scripts

Use oslo_db to create index and add missing testcases
for migration script 091, 098 and 099, also eliminate
the deprecation warning.

Change-Id: I6163489ca0f59160e7d3bfd837b72995be17c059

added_lines: TEXT_TYPE = sqlalchemy.types.Text def _check_040(self, engine, data): def _check_091(self, engine, data): self.assertTrue(engine.dialect.has_table(engine.connect(), "attachment_specs")) attachment = db_utils.get_table(engine, 'attachment_specs') self.assertIsInstance(attachment.c.created_at.type, self.TIME_TYPE) self.assertIsInstance(attachment.c.updated_at.type, self.TIME_TYPE) self.assertIsInstance(attachment.c.deleted_at.type, self.TIME_TYPE) self.assertIsInstance(attachment.c.deleted.type, self.BOOL_TYPE) self.assertIsInstance(attachment.c.id.type, self.INTEGER_TYPE) self.assertIsInstance(attachment.c.key.type, self.VARCHAR_TYPE) self.assertIsInstance(attachment.c.value.type, self.VARCHAR_TYPE) self.assertIsInstance(attachment.c.attachment_id.type, self.VARCHAR_TYPE) f_keys = self.get_foreign_key_columns(engine, 'attachment_specs') self.assertEqual({'attachment_id'}, f_keys) def _check_098(self, engine, data): self.assertTrue(engine.dialect.has_table(engine.connect(), "messages")) ids = self.get_indexed_columns(engine, 'messages') self.assertTrue('expires_at' in ids) def _check_099(self, engine, data): self.assertTrue(engine.dialect.has_table(engine.connect(), "volume_attachment")) attachment = db_utils.get_table(engine, 'volume_attachment') self.assertIsInstance(attachment.c.connection_info.type, self.TEXT_TYPE)

commit_message:
Merge pre|post puppet resources into pre|post config.

The [Pre|Post]Puppet resources were renamed in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/365763.
This was intended for having a pre/post deployment
steps using an agnostic name instead of
being attached to a technology.

The renaming was unintentionally reverted in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/393644/ and
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/434451.

This submission merge both resources into one,
and remove the old pre|post hooks.

Change-Id: Ic9d97f172efd2db74255363679b60f1d2dc4e064
Closes-bug: #1669756
(cherry picked from commit 258c6ce52d0c8467f34693722a883d96345802b2)

commit_message:
Fix fullstack error about one test

This fullstack test 'test_scheduled_operations_create_and_scheduled'
failed sometimes. The reason is that the sleep_time calculation is
not exact. The start_time is earlier than the value as expected. We
also need consider the time about checkpoint API execution.

Change-Id: I2ca67d3b2cf1a68b58028212b92467fcc8217caf

commit_message:
Remove args from BlockDevice() init

The args agument was only used to find the symbol for the getval
command.  Have the command pass the symbol to find in directly.  We
can therefore remove the args paramater to the BlockDevice() creation.

Change-Id: I8e357131b70a00e4a2c4792c009f6058d1d5ae9e

deleted_lines: def __init__(self, params, args): self.args = args def cmd_getval(self): This is needed for backward compatibility (non python) access to (internal) configuration. symbol = self.args.symbol

commit_message:
Move to subparsers

Move argument parsing to subparsers, rather than positional arguments.
This better reflects the tool's role as a driver and allows
sub-commands to deal with arguments in a natural way.

Change-Id: Iae8c368e0f3fe47abfddb9e0a1558bd5b3423aee

EXIT dib-block-device --phase=umount ... dib-block-device --phase=cleanup ...

subject: Keystone endpoint should be versionless
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-09 09:18:02.000000000', 'files': ['helm/microservice/keystone-create-endpoints-job/templates/keystone-create-endpoints.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes/commit/04c44218662e70911ee66b4ac709def924d3e764', 'message': 'Keystone endpoint should be versionless

Nova's quota-set api will validate project id after pike release, but it
will force to using keystone version v3 with following url
"/v3/projects/%s". If keystone endpoint suffix with version, then
request url will be "/v3/v3/projects/%s". Nova will raise bad request
and quota-set api can not work.

The keystone endpoint should be versionless.

Change-Id: I202e212db22af4f56a43283db67b6b583c39a6dd
Related-Bug: 1667679
'}]
commit_message:
Keystone endpoint should be versionless

Nova's quota-set api will validate project id after pike release, but it
will force to using keystone version v3 with following url
"/v3/projects/%s". If keystone endpoint suffix with version, then
request url will be "/v3/v3/projects/%s". Nova will raise bad request
and quota-set api can not work.

The keystone endpoint should be versionless.

Change-Id: I202e212db22af4f56a43283db67b6b583c39a6dd
Related-Bug: 1667679
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes refs/changes/00/463500/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Fix misnamed variable in config
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-08 03:24:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/39aed7626be6c3a101f2f2710245055a9c1e6079', 'message': "Fix misnamed variable in config

The `caching` configuration option for the catalog section was
instead storing the configuration in a `aching` variable. I'm
assuming that this was suppose to be `caching` given the convention
of all the other sub-systems within keystone and how they implement
caching. This could have had performance impacts if operators thought
they were enabling caching behavior but actually weren't seeing any
performance increase because the implemention looks for `caching` as
the registered configuration option instead of `aching`. This seems
to have been introduced in:

  https://github.com/openstack/keystone/commit/d9c6b50a3ae514e640fa13a344e59fe3649ee0ef

Performance impact here could be significant if the catalog is of
substantial size since it would be rebuilt every time a token is
validated.

Change-Id: I04e71ba12a86106bc2e50daa139666bd89a6854c
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-05-08 05:00:57.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/conf/catalog.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/5cceff5c69bb71a3715c1a76b97ec9c29b6e95fa', 'message': "Fix misnamed variable in config

The `caching` configuration option for the catalog section was
instead storing the configuration in a `aching` variable. I'm
assuming that this was suppose to be `caching` given the convention
of all the other sub-systems within keystone and how they implement
caching. This could have had performance impacts if operators thought
they were enabling caching behavior but actually weren't seeing any
performance increase because the implemention looks for `caching` as

to have been introduced in:

  https://github.com/openstack/keystone/commit/d9c6b50a3ae514e640fa13a344e59fe3649ee0ef

validated.

Change-Id: I04e71ba12a86106bc2e50daa139666bd89a6854c
"}]
commit_message:
Fix misnamed variable in config

The `caching` configuration option for the catalog section was
instead storing the configuration in a `aching` variable. I'm
assuming that this was suppose to be `caching` given the convention
of all the other sub-systems within keystone and how they implement
caching. This could have had performance impacts if operators thought
they were enabling caching behavior but actually weren't seeing any
performance increase because the implemention looks for `caching` as
the registered configuration option instead of `aching`. This seems
to have been introduced in:

  https://github.com/openstack/keystone/commit/d9c6b50a3ae514e640fa13a344e59fe3649ee0ef

Performance impact here could be significant if the catalog is of
substantial size since it would be rebuilt every time a token is
validated.

Change-Id: I04e71ba12a86106bc2e50daa139666bd89a6854c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/27/463227/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix conditional check error when run galera-bootstrap tag

Task "Start mysql node normally" needs to add "galera-bootstrap"
tag or it will causing conditional check error on mysql_started
variable

Change-Id: Id7e3fd30480b39b200cffb085c212b5ab5229f04
Closes-Bug: #1680694
(cherry picked from commit 61609d8f9f99826cd4a519ebde81efdf7d697e76)

commit_message:
Tests and fixups for sharding stats reporting

Test the stats logged during the run_forever method.

Simplify stats handling by using a dict to accumulate stats.

Log stats after every pass during run_forever, and at end of run_once.

commit_message:
Disabling replacing fernet keys from puppet

Once puppet has written the initial fernet keys, if a deployer wants to
rotate them, the keys will be overwritten when another overcloud deploy
is executed (for instance, for updates or upgrades). This disables
replacing this keys via puppet, so now the operator can rotate the keys
out of band.

Change-Id: I01fd46ba7c5e0db12524095dc9fe29e90cb0de57

commit_message:
Added missing info: ceilometer cinder install doc

The ceilometer install guide for Newton is missing some
important information regarding command -
"cinder-volume-usage-audit". Also it is missing
instructions regarding cron job to be added. This
infomation is available in Ocata documentation but missing
in Newton's ceilometer docs.

Added the file `install-cinder-config-common.inc` which
contains common information, added the file reference in
the pages wherever suitable.

Also, removed unnecessary section details of the link in last
sentence of configure services pages
- #block-storage-audit-script-setup-to-get-notifications

Change-Id: I90989c1f883bc294e6b475158406c81454b1c7a8
Closes-Bug: #1682112

lookup exceptions, but still not all.  Server failures are still
interesting, for example.

commit_message:
Make docker-puppet.sh a static file.

Variables are now passed in with --env in the docker run call.

This will allow docker-puppet.sh to be baked into the image instead of
having it as a custom entrypoint.

Change-Id: Icbaefe033becc6b2226535f28ee202917bdc1074

commit_message:
Add node_staging_uri and enable_image_import opts

The node_staging_uri will be used for the API logic saving the data
user uploads to the new staging endpoint and async flow to pick it
from there when processing the rest of the workflow.

For the first iteration, only FS path is allowed and supported.

URI format used to provide future expansion for possibility to use
different shared backends between the nodes. The location access must
be shared between the nodes.

The enable_image_import config option is introduced as deprecated and
is only there to ensure smooth upgrades. Having it disabled per default
in Pike allows glance-api to start and operate with Newton config
files and the new feature disabled.

From Queens onwards 'node_staging_uri' option must be configured for full
operation of glance-api as the enable_image_import will default to True.
At this point the 'enable_image_import' option will become redundant
and can be removed on R.

Change-Id: Ie5ab21ec3f9c880fa042dcc68865c1fceb9463ec
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/41/391441/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cfg.StrOpt('node_staging_uri', default='file:///tmp/', help=_(""" The location where Glance API node saves staged image data This option is for Glance internal use only. Glance will save the image data uploaded by the user to the staging during the image import process. This is also the location task flows will look that image data from if the staging option was used. This option does not change the staging API endpoint by any means. NOTE: It is discouraged to use same path as [TASKS]/work_dir NOTE: 'file:///<path>' is the only option api_image_import flow will support on this first stage of MVP. NOTE: The staging mount point needs to be shared FS between the Glance API nodes. Possible values: * String starting with 'file://' followed by FS path Relation options: * [TASKS]/work_dir """)),

commit_message:
Add gnocchi

Currently gnocchi uses 'metric' as service type, but I am not
sure it is appropriate. Gnocchi is a time-series metric database,
so 'metric-database' might be better.

Change-Id: Iaeb6981afff9bd4e61c0f884cb87713881a3cb21

commit_message:
Deprecate Heat/Orchestration configuration options

Heat service client, configuration and test will move out of
Tempest. Since configuration is a stable interface for Tempest
we start deprecation on the configuration options, so that
we can remove them in a cycle time.

Change-Id: Id0f69f3b60cbb4f4a1f1fa7e18c7700490d6656a

commit_message:
Add support for Cinder "NAS secure" driver params

Add ability to set Cinder's nas_secure_file_operations and
nas_secure_file_permissions driver parameters. Two sets of identically
named parameters are implemented by Cinder's NFS and NetApp back end
drivers.

The ability to control these parameters is crucial for supporting deployments
that require non-default values.

Partial-Bug: #1688332
Depends-On: Id92cfd4190de8687d4731cf301f2df0bde1ba7d9
Change-Id: I76e2ce10acf7b671be6a2785829ebb3012b79308

Closes-Bug: #1686349

commit_message:
Fix Telegraf container restarting issue

Telegraf always restart containers when doing reconfigure, due to
"pid_mode" attribut missing during compare_container.
Hence compare_container always evaluated to True.

Change-Id: I335816ebf99a218a5400b2baae5b55788459bfff
Closes-Bug: #1686349
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/14/460014/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
libvirt: Fix races in glusterfs mount/umount

Change I3155984d introduced LibvirtMountedFileSystemVolumeDriver,
which uses mount._HostMountStateManager to ensure volumes using it are
mounted and unmounted robustly and without racing. This change updates
the GlusterFS volume driver to use the same framework.

Change-Id: I637d9a102c265cf7ef582b80e053a3ced0b99bbd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/02/423402/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class LibvirtGlusterfsVolumeDriver(fs.LibvirtMountedFileSystemVolumeDriver): def __init__(self, connection): super(LibvirtGlusterfsVolumeDriver, self).__init__(connection, 'glusterfs') def _mount_options(self, connection_info): conn_options = connection_info['data'].get('options') if conn_options is not None: return conn_options.split(' ') return []
deleted_lines: from oslo_concurrency import processutilsimport sixfrom nova.i18n import _LE, _LW from nova import utils from nova.virt.libvirt import utils as libvirt_utilsclass LibvirtGlusterfsVolumeDriver(fs.LibvirtBaseFileSystemVolumeDriver): def connect_volume(self, connection_info, mount_device): if 'gluster' not in CONF.libvirt.qemu_allowed_storage_drivers: self._ensure_mounted(connection_info) connection_info['data']['device_path'] = \ self._get_device_path(connection_info) def disconnect_volume(self, connection_info, disk_dev): """Disconnect the volume.""" if 'gluster' in CONF.libvirt.qemu_allowed_storage_drivers: return mount_path = self._get_mount_path(connection_info) try: utils.execute('umount', mount_path, run_as_root=True) except processutils.ProcessExecutionError as exc: export = connection_info['data']['export'] if 'target is busy' in six.text_type(exc): LOG.debug("The GlusterFS share %s is still in use.", export) else: LOG.exception(_LE("Couldn't unmount the GlusterFS share %s"), export) def _ensure_mounted(self, connection_info): """@type connection_info: dict """ glusterfs_export = connection_info['data']['export'] mount_path = self._get_mount_path(connection_info) if not libvirt_utils.is_mounted(mount_path, glusterfs_export): options = connection_info['data'].get('options') self._mount_glusterfs(mount_path, glusterfs_export, options, ensure=True) return mount_path def _mount_glusterfs(self, mount_path, glusterfs_share, options=None, ensure=False): """Mount glusterfs export to mount path.""" utils.execute('mkdir', '-p', mount_path) gluster_cmd = ['mount', '-t', 'glusterfs'] if options is not None: gluster_cmd.extend(options.split(' ')) gluster_cmd.extend([glusterfs_share, mount_path]) try: utils.execute(*gluster_cmd, run_as_root=True) except processutils.ProcessExecutionError as exc: if ensure and 'already mounted' in six.text_type(exc): LOG.warning(_LW("%s is already mounted"), glusterfs_share) else: raise

'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2016-10-14 15:18:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/27fbd08a1c86416bebcc0cf8a01407ae9273fc1b', 'message': 'WIP libvirt: Fix races with nfs volume mount/umount

Closes-Bug: #1421550
Change-Id: I3155984d76df06371a6c45f633aa448168a96d64
'}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2016-10-21 15:38:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/57e5b52ce144fc381f57652b6910244ddd843ec0', 'message': "libvirt: Fix races with nfs volume mount/umount

A single nfs export typically contains multiple volumes. We were
handling this in the libvirt driver by:

1. On mount, we 'ensure' the mount is available, so we don't fail if
   another instance already has it mounted.

2. On umount, we trap and ignore 'device is busy' so we don't fail if
   another instance is already using it.

Unfortunately, while this works for serial mounts and unmounts, there
are multiple failure cases when volumes from the same export and
mounted and unmounted simultaneously.

To fix this, the libvirt driver now holds a single instance of a
MountManager. This tracks mounts and umount requests per export, and
calls the real mount/umount only when required. It uses per-export
locks to avoid races. Because we now expect to know the state of the
host at all times, we no longer need to execute speculative
mount/umount commands.

This change implements this for nfs, but the solution is intended to
be extended to all LibvirtBaseFileSystemVolumeDrivers.

Closes-Bug: #1421550
Change-Id: I3155984d76df06371a6c45f633aa448168a96d64
"}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2016-10-21 15:48:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/24451e5bfa47bbac862e234abf89eb9fb9daeaf8', 'message': "libvirt: Fix races with nfs volume mount/umount

locks to avoid races. Because we now expect to know the state of the
host at all times, we no longer need to execute speculative
mount/umount commands.

This change implements this for nfs, but the solution is intended to
be extended to all LibvirtBaseFileSystemVolumeDrivers.

Closes-Bug: #1421550
Change-Id: I3155984d76df06371a6c45f633aa448168a96d64

avoiding races. Because we now expect to know the state of the host at
all times, we no longer need to execute speculative mount/umount
commands.

than volumes, we also gracefully support multi-attach.

This change implements this for nfs, but the solution is intended to
be extended to all LibvirtBaseFileSystemVolumeDrivers.

commit_message:
libvirt: Fix races with nfs volume mount/umount

A single nfs export typically contains multiple volumes. We were
handling this in the libvirt driver by:

1. On mount, we 'ensure' the mount is available, so we don't fail if
   another instance already has it mounted.

2. On umount, we trap and ignore 'device is busy' so we don't fail if
   another instance is already using it.

Unfortunately, while this works for serial mounts and unmounts, there
are multiple failure cases when volumes from the same export are
mounted and unmounted simultaneously. It causes an error if an
instance is stopped: as the qemu process is not actively using the
mountpoint it will not prevent an unmount for another volume on the
same mountpoint from succeeding. It will not be possible to restart
the instance, because its mountpoint will not be mounted.

To fix this, we create a singleton manager object, which tracks mounts
and umount requests per export, and calls the real mount/umount only
when required. It uses per-export locks to allow concurrency while
avoiding races. Because we now expect to know the state of the host at
all times, we no longer need to execute speculative mount/umount
commands.

As we track attachments (a mapping from volume to instance) rather
than volumes, we also gracefully support multi-attach.

This change implements this for nfs, but the solution is intended to
be extended to all LibvirtBaseFileSystemVolumeDrivers.

Closes-Bug: #1421550
Change-Id: I3155984d76df06371a6c45f633aa448168a96d64
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/59/383859/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import collections import contextlib import logging import os.path import threading from oslo_concurrency import processutils from nova.i18n import _LE from nova import utils LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) class MountManager(object): class _ManagedMount(object): def __init__(self): self.lock = threading.Lock() self.volumes = [] self.mounted = False def __init__(self, host): self.mountpoints = collections.defaultdict(self._ManagedMount) for guest in host.list_guests(only_running=False): for disk in guest.get_all_disks(): # All remote filesystem volumes are files if disk.type != 'file': continue # NOTE(mdbooth): We're assuming that the mountpoint is our # immediate parent, which is currently true for all # volume drivers. We deliberately don't do anything clever # here, because we don't want to, e.g.: # * Add mountpoints for non-volume disks # * Get it wrong when a non-running domain references a # volume which isn't mounted because the host just rebooted. # and this is good enough. We could probably do better here # with more thought. mountpoint = os.path.dirname(disk.source_path) if not os.path.ismount(mountpoint): continue name = os.path.relpath(disk.source_path, mountpoint) # No locking required here because this is running before # we start servicing user requests mount = self.mountpoints[mountpoint] mount.volumes.append(name) mount.volumes.mounted = True @contextlib.contextmanager def _get_locked(self, mountpoint): # This dance is because we delete locks. We need to be sure that the # lock we hold does not belong to an object which has been deleted. # We do this by checking that mountpoint still refers to this object # when we hold the lock. This is safe because: # * we only delete an object from mountpounts whilst holding its lock # * mountpoints is a defaultdict which will atomically create a new # object on access while True: mount = self.mountpoints[mountpoint] with mount.lock: if self.mountpoints[mountpoint] is mount: yield mount break def mount(self, driver, connection_info): export = connection_info['data']['export'] vol_name = connection_info['data']['name'] mountpoint = self._get_mount_path(connection_info) with self._get_locked(mountpoint) as mount: if not mount.mounted: utils.execute('mkdir', '-p', mountpoint) mount_cmd = (driver.mount_cmd(connection_info) + [export, mountpoint]) # We're not expected to be mounted already, so we let errors # propagate try: utils.execute(*mount_cmd, run_as_root=True) except Exception: # If the mount failed there's no reason for us to keep a # record of it. It will be created again if the caller # retries. # Delete while holding lock del self.mountpoints[mountpoint] raise mount.mounted = True mount.volumes.append(vol_name) def umount(self, driver, connection_info): mountpoint = self._get_mount_path(connection_info) vol_name = connection_info['data']['name'] with self._get_locked(mountpoint) as mount: # This will raise ValueError if share isn't in volumes, which is # as good an error as any. mount.volumes.remove(vol_name) if len(mount.volumes) == 0: try: utils.execute('umount', mountpoint, run_as_root=True, attempts=3, delay_on_retry=True) utils.execute('rmdir', mountpoint) # Delete while holding lock del self.mountpoints[mountpoint] self.mounted = False except processutils.ProcessExecutionError: LOG.error(_LE("Couldn't unmount the share %s"), mountpoint)

subject: Bump OS_BAREMETAL_API_VERSION to 1.29
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-09 12:20:33.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/ironic-api-version-d2b4ec1474918f12.yaml', 'elements/undercloud-install/os-apply-config/root/stackrc'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/instack-undercloud/commit/d286b7fb753c381d0ddc5ed74fcf594488bbd273', 'message': 'Bump OS_BAREMETAL_API_VERSION to 1.29

This way the CLI and OSC users can use the latest features without specifying
the version explicitly. The final Ocata version is 1.31, but 1.29 is the most
recent version supported by ironicclient Ocata.

Change-Id: I4d5ea005dfce403b21143a9bab42960950c43b36

commit_message:
Bump OS_BAREMETAL_API_VERSION to 1.29

This way the CLI and OSC users can use the latest features without specifying
the version explicitly. The final Ocata version is 1.31, but 1.29 is the most
recent version supported by ironicclient Ocata.

Change-Id: I4d5ea005dfce403b21143a9bab42960950c43b36
Depends-On: I285178d0b7384956eb151ca66007d7354566574d
Partial-Bug: #1663203
(cherry picked from commit a57eef23204df7903f08e8060d178d69a4572deb)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/instack-undercloud refs/changes/51/463551/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # 1.29 is the latest API version in Ironic Ocata supported by ironicclient IRONIC_API_VERSION=1.29 OS_BAREMETAL_API_VERSION=$IRONIC_API_VERSIONexport IRONIC_API_VERSION

commit_message:
Add a basic mission statement

Bifrost's mission has been institutional knowledge
for some time, however we need to actually write
the mission behind the sub-project in someplace
easy to find and reference.

Change-Id: I641b484b271c6e73a8a248cf77b0bc902d0d602b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/bifrost refs/changes/91/456391/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ================= Bifrost's Mission ================= Those involved in bifrost from early on have tended to reach the consensus as to what the mission is for bifrost. That being said, this is institutional knowledge that *must* be recorded to help ensure a consitent direction moving forward. This is, by no means, set in stone. Bifrost's growth may necessitate revision in the future. Mission ======= The mission of bifrost is to provide an easy path to deploy ironic in a stand-alone fashion, in order to help facilitate the deployment of infrastucture. Meanwhile being an easily modifiable project that consumes the available components, enables users to make changes in order to support their needs, and helps drive forward the perspective of stand-alone use.

commit_message:
Ignore project-config in DLRN builds

When we set dependency on project-config patches, it shouldn't be
built by DLRN.

Change-Id: I06240876fe47de584d2ccdd9a9a56d53e827d2a6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras refs/changes/08/463708/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add missing node_count variable in the nodes/ config file

Some of the nodes/ config files missed the node_count
variable, so there are unusable via tripleo-ci scripts

Change-Id: Idea55aba8283900bdfa05760d16a35366b745066

commit_message:
Added example to plugin stable branch

This patch will help who wants the stable branch code to plugin

Change-Id: Iedf6870669308c1a7b523322f685fb52019918ef
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/searchlight refs/changes/69/456169/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: To use stable branches, make sure devstack is on that branch, and specify the branch name to enable_plugin, for example:: enable_plugin searchlight https://git.openstack.org/openstack/searchlight stable/mitaka

Corrected case, appended parenthesis and added
periods as required.

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-05 17:43:10.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/haproxy_install_hatop.yml', 'tasks/haproxy_ssl_key_store.yml', 'tasks/haproxy_pre_install.yml', 'tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-haproxy_server/commit/b29a72f8244d3b9d0f9655d465173493a5a61174', 'message': "Improve role idempotency

Add a 'creates' argument to the task installing HATop so that the task
is skipped if it's already installed. Remove 'changed_when' from slurp
tasks. Break the 'Test for log directory or link' shell task into a
couple tasks which use the stat and file module. Remove 'changed_when'
from slurp tasks. Also enable the idempotence test for the gate.

(cherry picked from commit 49da8afb897ad62add3b91fcfae83b221ae59169)

commit_message:
Improve role idempotency

Add a 'creates' argument to the task installing HATop so that the task
is skipped if it's already installed. Remove 'changed_when' from slurp
tasks. Break the 'Test for log directory or link' shell task into a
couple tasks which use the stat and file module. Remove 'changed_when'
from slurp tasks. Also enable the idempotence test for the gate.

Partial-Bug: 1640144
Change-Id: Id7fe24c9c1ae416abab69d4f42b65c9594805e10
(cherry picked from commit 49da8afb897ad62add3b91fcfae83b221ae59169)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-haproxy_server refs/changes/20/463020/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Handle failed actions

The result of syncrhonously called Mistral actions wasn't being checked
to see if the action passed or failed. The result is now checked and if
the action has failed, an exception will be raised.

Change-Id: I95ae8c98fec94cf91f3f209b593f6c1815729fd4
Closes-Bug: #1686811

commit_message:
Improve role idempotency

Add a 'creates' argument to the task installing HATop so that the task
is skipped if it's already installed. Remove 'changed_when' from slurp
tasks. Break the 'Test for log directory or link' shell task into a
couple tasks which use the stat and file module. Remove 'changed_when'
from slurp tasks. Also enable the idempotence test for the gate.

Partial-Bug: 1640144
Change-Id: Id7fe24c9c1ae416abab69d4f42b65c9594805e10
(cherry picked from commit 49da8afb897ad62add3b91fcfae83b221ae59169)

added_lines: def _sack(self, sack): return self.SACK_PREFIX % sack def upgrade(self, index): super(SwiftStorage, self).upgrade(index) for i in six.moves.range(self.NUM_SACKS): self.swift.put_container(self._sack(i)) self._sack(self.compute_sack(metric.id)), nb_metrics = 0 measures = 0 for i in six.moves.range(self.NUM_SACKS): if details: headers, files = self.swift.get_container(self._sack(i), full_listing=True) for f in files: metric, __ = f['name'].split("/", 1) metric_details[metric] += 1 else: headers, files = self.swift.get_container(self._sack(i), delimiter='/', full_listing=True) nb_metrics += len(files) measures += int(headers.get('x-container-object-count')) return (nb_metrics or len(metric_details), measures, metric_details if details else None) headers, files = self.swift.get_container(self._sack(sack), def _list_measure_files_for_metric_id(self, sack, metric_id): self._sack(sack), path=six.text_type(metric_id), sack = self.compute_sack(metric_id) files = self._list_measure_files_for_metric_id(sack, metric_id) swift.bulk_delete(self.swift, self._sack(sack), files) sack = self.compute_sack(metric.id) files = self._list_measure_files_for_metric_id(sack, metric.id) self._sack(sack), f['name']) swift.bulk_delete(self.swift, self._sack(sack), files)

file: push to multiple sacks

added_lines: def upgrade(self, index): super(FileStorage, self).upgrade(index) utils.ensure_paths([self._sack_path(i) for i in six.moves.range(self.NUM_SACKS)]) utils.ensure_paths([self.basepath_tmp]) def _sack_path(self, sack): return os.path.join(self.basepath, self.SACK_PREFIX % sack) def _measure_path(self, sack, metric_id): return os.path.join(self._sack_path(sack), six.text_type(metric_id)) sack = self.compute_sack(metric_id) path = self._measure_path(sack, metric_id) for i in six.moves.range(self.NUM_SACKS): for metric in self.list_metric_with_measures_to_process(i): metric_details[metric] = len( self._list_measures_container_for_metric_id_str(i, metric)) return set(self._list_target(self._sack_path(sack))) def _list_measures_container_for_metric_id_str(self, sack, metric_id): return self._list_target(self._measure_path(sack, metric_id)) return self._list_target(self._build_measure_path(metric_id)) @staticmethod def _list_target(target): try: return os.listdir(target)
deleted_lines: self.measure_path = os.path.join(self.basepath, 'measure') def upgrade(self, indexer): super(FileStorage, self).upgrade(indexer) utils.ensure_paths([self.basepath_tmp, self.measure_path]) path = os.path.join(self.measure_path, six.text_type(metric_id)) for metric in os.listdir(self.measure_path): metric_details[metric] = len( self._list_measures_container_for_metric_id(metric)) return set(os.listdir(self.measure_path)) try: return os.listdir(self._build_measure_path(metric_id))

commit_message:
redis: push to multiple sacks

enable redis to push to multiple sacks and handle them accordingly

Change-Id: I84c046b80fa46d172dfee69dc4987e8b5a860a1f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/gnocchi refs/changes/39/453239/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: return redis.SEP.join([self.SACK_PREFIX % self.compute_sack(metric_id), six.text_type(metric_id)]) match = redis.SEP.join([self.SACK_PREFIX % "*", "*"]) match = redis.SEP.join([self.SACK_PREFIX % sack, "*"]) return set([k.decode('utf8').split(redis.SEP)[1] for k in keys])
deleted_lines: STORAGE_PREFIX = "incoming" return redis.SEP.join([self.STORAGE_PREFIX, six.text_type(metric_id)]) match = redis.SEP.join([self.STORAGE_PREFIX, "*"]) match = redis.SEP.join([self.STORAGE_PREFIX, "*"]) measures = set([k.decode('utf8').split(redis.SEP)[1] for k in keys]) return measures

Change-Id: Ife3b58105d7cd17a824119f7ef3c369ad1b419a0

commit_message:
add note to clear backlog before upgrade

upgrade is a single process, even with threads, it will be slow
as hell to upgrade unprocessed measures versus just clearing it with
tens or hundreds of metricd

Change-Id: Ife3b58105d7cd17a824119f7ef3c369ad1b419a0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/gnocchi refs/changes/58/463858/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. note:: Data in backlog is never migrated between versions. Ensure the backlog is empty before any upgrade to ensure data is not lost.

'}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2017-02-10 18:02:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla/commit/d717f0f994846d0f5b3089606ff6f21acd7d952c', 'message': "support non-x86 architectures (aarch64, ppc64le)

Based on ppc64le changes by Sajauddin Mohammad [1]

1. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/423239/6

Tested with aarch64/ubuntu and aarch64/debian base images.

Changelog:

V6:
- ship distro sources.list as /etc/apt/sources.list
  - no more duplicates for security.debian.org (which was harmless)
- set 'base-arch' to be same as host architecture

V5:
- ship distro sources.list as /etc/apt/sources.list.d/{distro}.list
- ship architecture specific sources.list as
  /etc/apt/sources.list.d/{arch}.list
- added Linaro Ceph and Linaro Overlay repositories for Debian
- added Linaro repositories key
- define 'base_compiler_packages' for each distro and then use 'install'
  macro to get them in system - needed for building dump-init for
  !x86-64 architectures

V4:
- fixed line length for pep8 check

V3:
- drop hardcoding of 'base_image' variable as there is CLI argument for
  it
- expand help for '--base-image' argument with info for !x86-64 archs

V2:
- fix check for !x86-64 to get it working at all

Change-Id: If0ccc58d436b2468cd477c222ebc2fe0073206e9
"}, {'number': 7, 'created': '2017-02-15 17:49:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla/commit/e9b05f1f6e5f463bd9ace51e176bb1d0ec4c38d2', 'message': "support non-x86 architectures (aarch64, ppc64le)

Changelog:

V7:
- fixed Ubuntu-ports repos for aarch64 and ppc64le
- added empty sources.list for Debian/ppc64le
- added link to blueprint (suggested by sdake)

V6:
- ship distro sources.list as /etc/apt/sources.list
  - no more duplicates for security.debian.org (which was harmless)
- set 'base-arch' to be same as host architecture

V5:
- ship distro sources.list as /etc/apt/sources.list.d/{distro}.list
- ship architecture specific sources.list as
  /etc/apt/sources.list.d/{arch}.list
- added Linaro Ceph and Linaro Overlay repositories for Debian
- added Linaro repositories key
- define 'base_compiler_packages' for each distro and then use 'install'
  macro to get them in system - needed for building dump-init for
  !x86-64 architectures

V4:
- fixed line length for pep8 check

V3:
- drop hardcoding of 'base_image' variable as there is CLI argument for
  it
- expand help for '--base-image' argument with info for !x86-64 archs

V2:
- fix check for !x86-64 to get it working at all

Partially-Implements: multiarch-and-arm64-containers

- added empty sources.list for Debian/ppc64le
- added link to blueprint (suggested by sdake)

V6:
- ship distro sources.list as /etc/apt/sources.list
  - no more duplicates for security.debian.org (which was harmless)
- set 'base-arch' to be same as host architecture

V5:
- ship distro sources.list as /etc/apt/sources.list.d/{distro}.list
- ship architecture specific sources.list as
  /etc/apt/sources.list.d/{arch}.list
- added Linaro Ceph and Linaro Overlay repositories for Debian
- added Linaro repositories key
- define 'base_compiler_packages' for each distro and then use 'install'
  macro to get them in system - needed for building dump-init for
  !x86-64 architectures

V4:
- fixed line length for pep8 check

V3:
- drop hardcoding of 'base_image' variable as there is CLI argument for
  it
- expand help for '--base-image' argument with info for !x86-64 archs

V2:
- fix check for !x86-64 to get it working at all

Partially-Implements: multiarch-and-arm64-containers

Change-Id: If0ccc58d436b2468cd477c222ebc2fe0073206e9

"}, {'number': 24, 'created': '2017-03-15 09:58:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla/commit/43cb71c531974e4c1d6a8b1a3cb4d7f65cdc5389', 'message': "Add support for non-x86 architectures (aarch64, ppc64le)

Based on ppc64le changes by Sajauddin Mohammad [1]

1. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/423239/6

Tested with:
- aarch64/ubuntu
- aarch64/debian
- centos/aarch64
- ppc64le/ubuntu

Changelog:

V15:
- CentOS: added comment to not get 'install_packages' macro join RUN
  command - no idea why that happened ;(

V14:
- CentOS: define 'base_compiler_packages' globally as we use them for
  binary and source builds.

V13:
- CentOS: handle another set of repo keys

V12:
- CentOS: install repo keys only on x86-64
- CentOS: handle DELOREAN(_DEPS) to be None on !x86-64

V11:
- CentOS support
- dumb-init set to 1.1.3 like on x86-64

V10:
- dropped commas from end of lists

V9:
- dropped reject/original files which got into V8
- added MariaDB repository for Ubuntu/ppc64le

V8:
- rebased as ceph key got merged

V7:
- fixed Ubuntu-ports repos for aarch64 and ppc64le
- added empty sources.list for Debian/ppc64le
- added link to blueprint (suggested by sdake)

V6:
- ship distro sources.list as /etc/apt/sources.list
  - no more duplicates for security.debian.org (which was harmless)
- set 'base-arch' to be same as host architecture

V5:
- ship distro sources.list as /etc/apt/sources.list.d/{distro}.list
- ship architecture specific sources.list as
  /etc/apt/sources.list.d/{arch}.list
- added Linaro Ceph and Linaro Overlay repositories for Debian
- added Linaro repositories key
- define 'base_compiler_packages' for each distro and then use 'install'
  macro to get them in system - needed for building dump-init for
  !x86-64 architectures

V4:
- fixed line length for pep8 check

V3:
- drop hardcoding of 'base_image' variable as there is CLI argument for
  it
- expand help for '--base-image' argument with info for !x86-64 archs

V2:
- fix check for !x86-64 to get it working at all

Partially-Implements: blueprint multiarch-and-arm64-containers

Change-Id: If0ccc58d436b2468cd477c222ebc2fe0073206e9

commit_message:
Support non-x86 architectures (aarch64, ppc64le)

Based on ppc64le changes by Sajauddin Mohammad [1]

1. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/423239/6

Tested with centos, debian, ubuntu on aarch64 and ppc64le.

Partially-Implements: blueprint multiarch-and-arm64-containers

Change-Id: If0ccc58d436b2468cd477c222ebc2fe0073206e9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/40/430940/14 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: BASE_ARCH = ['x86_64', 'ppc64le', 'aarch64'] cfg.StrOpt('base-arch', default="x86_64", choices=BASE_ARCH, help='The base architecture. Default is x86_64'),

commit_message:
[suse] Add DOCKER_DEV to /etc/fstab

After kube-minions restart, we would like to have mounted
DOCKER_DEV again on minion nodes.

Change-Id: I3777c3584e00a397f9604eae8ce0f628d2dcb190
Closes-Bug: #1663526
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/99/432199/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Change ownership of overcloud image before virt-customize

When the overcloud image is copied over to the undercloud
user's home directory, it could retain ownership.
This review ensures that the image is owned by
the undercloud user so it can be modified.

Change-Id: If3f07c6723565850d3efea35c00ac9f0fde4595f

ODL provides websocket based notifications.
https://wiki.opendaylight.org/view/OpenDaylight_
Controller:MD-SAL:Restconf:Change_event_notification_
subscription.Currently Pseudo Agent port binding uses
polling to read host config from ODL. Websocket can
be used as alternative to receive notification for
host config changes. This patch adds the basic

The same framework can be used to receive
notifications other than host config. Other patches
to add websocket to pseudo agent port binding
driver will be added.

commit_message:
Adding Websocket client for ODL

ODL provides websocket based notifications.
https://wiki.opendaylight.org/view/OpenDaylight_Controller:MD-SAL:Restconf:Change_event_notification_subscription.
Currently Pseudo Agent port binding uses
polling to read host config from ODL. Websocket can
be used as alternative to receive notification for
host config changes. This patch adds the basic
framework for websocket client. The same framework
can be used to receive notifications other than host
config. Also changes to add websocket to pseudo agent
port binding driver is included.

Change-Id: Ia73d1f9d4def2497df987126d13422595cf4d7a0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-odl refs/changes/27/421127/36 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2016 OpenStack Foundation # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License from autobahn.asyncio import websocket try: import asyncio except ImportError: import trollius as asyncio import six.moves.urllib.parse as urlparse from networking_odl.common import client as odl_client from oslo_log import log from networking_odl._i18n import _LE, _LI, _LW LOG = log.getLogger(__name__) def odl_create_websocket_url(odl_url, path): """ ODL Websocket change notification subscription """ # Check ODL URL for details on this process # https://wiki.opendaylight.org/view/OpenDaylight_Controller:MD-SAL:Restconf: # Change_event_notification_subscription#rpc_create-data-change-event-subscription odl_websocket_url = """ restconf/operations/sal-remote:create-data-change-event-subscription""" odl_stream_url = """streams/stream/""" odl_rest_client = odl_client.OpenDaylightRestClient.create_client(odl_url) response = odl_rest_client.sendjson('post', odl_websocket_url, path) try: stream_name = response.json() except ValueError: LOG.error(_LE("got invalid stream name"), exc_info=True) return None stream_name = stream_name['output']['stream-name'] # Subscribe to stream. Returns websocket URL to listen to url = odl_stream_url + stream_name response = odl_rest_client.sendjson('get', url, None) listen_url = response.headers['location'] return listen_url class MessagingProtocol(websocket.WebSocketClientProtocol): """Class defines Messaging Protocol to be used with asyncio """ def __init__(self, path, handler): websocket.WebSocketClientProtocol.__init__(self) self.path = path self.handler = handler def onConnect(self, request): LOG.info(_LI("Websocket Client connecting: %s"), request.peer) def onOpen(self): LOG.info(_LI("WebSocket connection open")) def onMessage(self, payload, isBinary): LOG.info(_LI("WebSocket Message received: %s"), payload) # Call registered handler for this Message self.handler(payload) def onClose(self, wasClean, code, reason): LOG.info(_LI("WebSocket connection closed: %s"), reason) class ProtocolFactory(websocket.WebSocketClientFactory): """ Class to create MessageProtocol """ protocol = MessagingProtocol def __init__(self, path, handler): websocket.WebSocketClientFactory.__init__(self) self.handler = handler self.path = path def __call__(self): proto = self.protocol(self.path, self.handler) return proto class OpenDaylightAsyncioWebsocketClient(object): """ Class to collect and run Asyncio Event Loop """ def __init__(self): """ Dictionary to collect the URL's to receive notification""" self.url_handler_dict = dict() def _init_event_loop(self): self.loop = asyncio.new_event_loop() asyncio.set_event_loop(self.loop) def _start_event_loop(self): # Event loop blocks on this call self.loop.run_forever() def stop_event_loop(self): self.loop.call_soon_threadsafe(self.loop.stop) def _extract_hostname_port(self, url): purl = urlparse.urlsplit(url) return purl.hostname, purl.port # Event Loop needs to be run in a different thread def run_event_loop(self): self._init_event_loop() for stream_url, handler in self.url_handler_dict.items(): try: factory = websocket.WebSocketClientFactory(stream_url) # Generate a MessageProtocol for this pair # (stream_url, handler) factory.protocol = ProtocolFactory(stream_url, handler) hostname, port = self._extract_hostname_port(stream_url) coro = self.loop.create_connection(factory, hostname, port) self.loop.run_until_complete(coro) except Exception: LOG.error(_LI("Enable to process Websocket Client request")) self._start_event_loop() # Event loop waits for all URL's in the dict in the same thread def add_url(self, stream_url, handler): self.url_handler_dict.update({stream_url: handler})

subject: Make python entry points accessible from elements
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-11 08:22:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder/commit/21381c0bc398a19953ca839734b910752a53e482', 'message': 'Make python entry points accessible from elements

More and more functionality in diskimage-builder is implemented using
python.  Nevertheless until now the entry points defined in setup.cfg
are not usable from within the elements.

This patch creates a temporary dedicated python virtual environment
